edu.umn.se.trap.rules
Class TRAPRuleRegistry

java.lang.Object
  edu.umn.se.trap.rules.TRAPRuleRegistry

public class TRAPRuleRegistry
extends java.lang.Object

A registry of rules that are used to process a ReimbursementApp. When called to process, the registry will pass the app to the internal rules. The order they are processed in is as follows: 1. InputValidationRules 2. BusinessLogicRules 3. FinalizeRule (only one)

Author:
andrewh

Constructor Detail

TRAPRuleRegistry

public TRAPRuleRegistry()
Construct the rule registry. This will automatically add all known rules to the registry.

Method Detail

addInputValidationRule

public void addInputValidationRule(InputValidationRule rule)
Add an input validation rule to the registry.

Parameters:
rule - - the InputValidationRule to add to the registry.

addBusinessLogicRule

public void addBusinessLogicRule(BusinessLogicRule rule)
Add a business logic rule to the registry.

Parameters:
rule - - the BusinessLogicRule to add to the registry.

setFinalizeRule

public void setFinalizeRule(FinalizeRule rule)
Set the FinalizeRule for the registry. This is the rule that gets called after all other rules have been processed. There is only one of these.

Parameters:
rule - - The FinalizeRule to set for the registry.

loadAllRules

public void loadAllRules()
Add all known InputValidationRules and BusinessLogicRules to the registry

See Also:
TRAPRule

processApp

public void processApp(ReimbursementApp app)
                throws TRAPException
Start processing of a ReimbursementApp. This run through all registered rules. When all is completed, the output map within the app should be completed and ready for saving (baring any exceptions).

Parameters:
app - - The app to process
Throws:
TRAPException - - When there is an error during processing.
See Also:
ReimbursementApp
